units.title: Pre‑coat plates with Matrigel
units.text: 1 Pre-coat 24-well plates with GFR Matrigel as described in Reagent setup. The coated plates can be wrapped in Paraﬁlm and kept for ≤2 weeks at 4 oC.
units.rationale: Establishes a sterile, extracellular matrix surface for PSC attachment.

units.title: Dissociate PSC colonies with accutase
units.text: 5 Incubate at 37 oC for 5 min, allowing PSC colonies to dissociate into single cells.
units.rationale: Generates a single‑cell suspension needed for accurate seeding.

units.title: Centrifuge cells after dissociation
units.text: 8 Centrifuge the cells at 1,000 r.p.m. for 3 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Pellets cells to enable removal of dissociation enzyme and media exchange.

units.title: Plate cells at defined density with Y‑27632
units.text: 13 Plate the cells at a density of 100,000–150,000 cells/well in 500 μl of mTeSR1 including 10 μM Y-27632 on a Matrigel-coated tissue culture 24-well plate. Prepare cells with at least two independent wells to generate anterior and posterior gut spheroids at the same time.
units.rationale: Ensures uniform colony formation and supports cell survival during replating.

units.title: Change to fresh mTeSR1 without Y‑27632
units.text: 18 Aspirate old mTeSR1 with 10 μM Y-27632 to change the medium. Add fresh mTeSR1 without Y-27632 (Step 16), 500 μl/well for a 24-well plate.
units.rationale: Removes ROCK inhibitor to allow normal cell proliferation after attachment.

units.title: Dilute TrypLE with warm DMEM/F12
units.text: 34 Add 500 μl of warm DMEM/F12 to each well to sufﬁciently dilute the TrypLE.
units.rationale: Stops enzymatic activity and prepares cells for downstream handling.

units.title: Seed gut cell suspensions in ultra‑low attachment plates
units.text: 36 Plate the anterior or posterior gut cell suspensions in 96-well round-bottom ultra-low attachment plates at a density of 10,000 cells with 100 µl day 7 medium per well and incubate at 37 °C overnight to form spheroids. Prepare the same number of anterior and posterior spheroids.
units.rationale: Promotes 3D spheroid formation in a non‑adhesive environment.

units.title: Combine posterior and anterior spheroids
units.text: 37 On day 8, pick up one generated single posterior spheroid with entire medium in a well by using a mechanical pipette with a wide-bore 200-µl tip. Pipette up and down ﬁrst so that the spheroid gets suspended in the medium.
units.rationale: Allows physical pairing of the two spheroids for boundary formation.

units.title: Centrifuge and incubate fused spheroids
units.text: 39 Centrifuge the plate at 1,000 r.p.m. for 1 min to gather spheroids and incubate at 37 °C for 24 h to form fused boundary spheroids (anterior-posterior gut spheroid; A-P spheroids).
units.rationale: Facilitates contact and fusion of anterior and posterior spheroids.

units.title: Embed fused spheroids in Matrigel drops
units.text: 41 On day 9, embed A–P spheroids in Matrigel drops and culture in gut growth medium to generate multi-organ HBPOs (Fig. 3c). Maintain the spheroid cultures at 37 °C in an atmosphere of 5% CO2, 95% air and replace the gut growth medium every 4 d.
units.rationale: Provides a 3D matrix for further organoid maturation and multi‑organ development.
